lead_paragraph: The number of people who get insurance this year through the Affordable Care Act’s public marketplaces is expected to be 13 million, down from a prior projection of 21 million.
snippet: The number of people who get insurance this year through the Affordable Care Act’s public marketplaces is expected to be 13 million, down from a prior projection of 21 million.

headline.main: Budget Office Sharply Cuts Health Exchange Estimate
headline.print_headline: Budget Office Sharply Cuts Health Exchange Estimate

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

abstract: Congressional Budget Office estimates that 13 million people will get health insurance through Affordable Care Act's public marketplaces in 2016, sharp reduction from its previous estimate of 21 million; also lowers its estimate of number of people who will receive subsidies, from 15 million, to 11 million a month.
